You are an expert React, TypeScript, and TailwindCSS developer with a keen eye for modern, aesthetically pleasing design.

Your task is to create a stunning, contemporary, and highly functional website based on the user's request using a SINGLE static React JSX file, which exports a default component. This code will go directly into the App.tsx file and will be used to render the website.

General guidelines:
- Ensure the React app is a single page application with a cohesive design language throughout.
- DO NOT include any external libraries, frameworks, or dependencies outside of what is already installed.
- For icons, create simple, elegant SVG icons. DO NOT use any icon libraries.
- Utilize TailwindCSS for styling, focusing on creating a visually appealing and responsive layout.
- Avoid using arbitrary values (e.g., `h-[600px]`). Stick to Tailwind's predefined classes for consistency.
- Use mock data instead of making HTTP requests or API calls to external services.
- Implement a carefully chosen, harmonious color palette that enhances the overall aesthetic.
- Utilize Tailwind's typography classes to create a clear visual hierarchy and improve readability.
- Incorporate subtle animations and transitions to add polish and improve user experience.
- Ensure proper spacing and alignment using Tailwind's margin, padding, and flexbox/grid classes.
- Implement responsive design principles to ensure the website looks great on all device sizes.
- Use modern UI patterns like cards, gradients, and subtle shadows to add depth and visual interest.
- Incorporate whitespace effectively to create a clean, uncluttered design.
- Consider implementing a dark mode option for enhanced user preference support.
- For images, use a placeholder image from https://placehold.co/

Technical Implementation:
- Use TypeScript for type safety and better code organization
- Implement proper state management using React hooks (useState, useEffect, useContext, etc.)
- Create reusable custom hooks for common functionality
- Use proper TypeScript interfaces and types for all props and state
- Implement error boundaries for graceful error handling
- Use React.memo() for performance optimization where appropriate
- Implement proper form validation and error handling
- Use proper accessibility attributes (ARIA labels, roles, etc.)
- Implement keyboard navigation support
- Ensure semantic HTML structure
- Use React.lazy() and Suspense for code splitting if needed
- Implement proper loading states and skeleton screens
- Use proper error messages and user feedback
- Implement proper form submission handling
- Use proper data validation and sanitization
- Implement proper routing if needed using URL hash navigation
- Use localStorage/sessionStorage for client-side data persistence
- Implement proper event handling and cleanup

UI/UX Design Focus:
- Typography: Use a combination of font weights and sizes to create visual interest and hierarchy
- Color: Implement a cohesive color scheme that complements the content and enhances usability
- Layout: Design an intuitive and balanced layout that guides the user's eye and facilitates easy navigation
- Microinteractions: Add subtle hover effects, transitions, and animations to enhance user engagement
- Consistency: Maintain a consistent design language throughout all components and sections
- Mobile-first approach: Design for mobile devices first, then enhance for larger screens
- Touch targets: Ensure all interactive elements are large enough for touch input
- Loading states: Implement skeleton screens and loading indicators
- Error states: Design clear error messages and recovery paths
- Empty states: Design meaningful empty states with clear calls to action
- Success states: Provide clear feedback for successful actions
- Interactive elements: Design clear hover and active states
- Form design: Create intuitive and user-friendly forms with proper validation feedback
- Navigation: Implement clear and consistent navigation patterns
- Search functionality: Implement proper search UI if needed
- Filtering and sorting: Design clear UI for data manipulation if needed
- Pagination: Implement proper pagination UI if needed
- Modal and dialog design: Create proper modal and dialog UI if needed
- Toast notifications: Implement proper notification system if needed
- Progress indicators: Show clear progress for multi-step processes
- Data visualization: Implement clear and intuitive data visualizations if needed

Pay special attention to the following. Make sure the app is usable and functional and works as expected.

Remember to only return code for the App.tsx file and nothing else. Prioritize creating an exceptional layout, styling, and reactivity. The resulting application should be visually impressive, highly functional, and something users would be proud to showcase.

i want to build a website/app for a local business in louisiana small town called Easy Rider Transportation, and I want it to be able to have features like booking, payment, and whatever else would be useful to customers needing to get and book a ride whether its for the future or for ASAP, and also need it to be able to have features for the owner so they can get some automated stuff like automatically giving the ride to the next available driver or something. Or maybe like where the different drivers can log in the app and the owner can see who is logged on at any given time. Kind of like clocking in. So the owner knows which drivers are on the clock and available to take rides right now for whenever they get a booking for a ride. Any other features that are simple but that can make the business run smoothly and effieciently so that the owner has to do less maintenence and stuff and the website/web app automates most things.

Let's break down the task into more detailed subtasks and expand on each one to ensure we cover all necessary aspects for creating a stunning, contemporary, and highly functional website using React, TypeScript, and TailwindCSS. ### Subtasks 1. **Project Setup and Structure** - Ensure the project is set up with TypeScript and TailwindCSS. - Organize the project structure for better maintainability. 2. **Design System Development** - Define a cohesive color palette. - Create a typography scale. - Develop a set of reusable UI components with consistent styles. 3. **Homepage Design and Implementation** - Create a hero section with a compelling headline, subheadline, and call-to-action. - Implement a navigation bar with links to different sections. - Add a footer with contact information and social media links. 4. **Section: About Us** - Create a section that introduces the company/team. - Include a brief overview and some key points about the mission and values. 5. **Section: Services** - List the services offered by the company. - Use cards to display each service with a title, description, and icon. 6. **Section: Portfolio** - Display a portfolio of recent projects. - Use cards to show project thumbnails with titles and descriptions. - Implement a modal view for detailed project descriptions. 7. **Section: Testimonials** - Include testimonials from satisfied customers. - Use cards to display quotes with client names and photos. 8. **Section: Blog** - Display a list of recent blog posts. - Use cards to show post titles, excerpts, and publication dates. - Implement a modal view for detailed blog post content. 9. **Contact Form** - Create a contact form with fields for name, email, message, and a submit button. - Implement form validation and error handling. - Provide feedback on successful form submission. 10. **Responsive Design** - Ensure the website is fully responsive and looks great on all devices. - Test the website on different screen sizes and browsers. 11. **Dark Mode** - Implement a toggle for dark mode. - Ensure all components are styled correctly in both light and dark mode. 12. **Animations and Transitions** - Add subtle animations for hover and focus states. - Implement smooth transitions for navigation and modal views. 13. **Accessibility** - Ensure all interactive elements are accessible. - Use ARIA labels and roles where necessary. - Implement keyboard navigation support. 14. **SEO Considerations** - Add meta tags for SEO. - Ensure the website is crawlable by search engines. 15. **Testing and Optimization** - Perform thorough testing for functionality and usability. - Optimize images and assets for performance. - Use React.memo() for performance optimization where appropriate. 16. **Documentation** - Document the codebase with comments and type definitions. - Provide usage instructions for future maintenance. ### Expanded Task Let's now expand on the main task with detailed implementations for each section. ```tsx import React, { useState } from 'react'; // Define interfaces for type safety interface Service { title: string; description: string; icon: JSX.Element; } interface Testimonial { name: string; quote: string; photo: string; } interface BlogPost { title: string; excerpt: string; date: string; } // Mock data const services: Service[] = [ { title: 'Web Design', description: 'Create visually stunning websites that engage your audience.', icon: , }, { title: 'SEO', description: 'Optimize your website for search engines to attract more traffic.', icon: , }, ]; const testimonials: Testimonial[] = [ { name: 'John Doe', quote: 'Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.', photo: 'https://placehold.co/100x100', }, { name: 'Jane Smith', quote: 'Sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.', photo: 'https://placehold.co/100x100', }, ]; const blogPosts: BlogPost[] = [ { title: 'Introduction to React', excerpt: 'Learn the basics of React and how to create a single page application.', date: 'October 1, 2023', }, { title: 'Advanced TypeScript', excerpt: 'Discover advanced TypeScript features and best practices.', date: 'September 15, 2023', }, ]; const App: React.FC = () => { const [isDarkMode, setIsDarkMode] = useState(false); const toggleDarkMode = () => { setIsDarkMode(!isDarkMode); }; return (

A portfolio of recent projects is displayed. - Cards show project thumbnails with titles and descriptions. 7. **Section: Testimonials**: - Testimonials from satisfied customers are included. - Cards display quotes with client names and photos. 8. **Section: Blog**: - A list of recent blog posts is displayed. - Cards show post titles, excerpts, and publication dates. 9. **Contact Form**: - A contact form with fields for name, email, message, and a submit button is created. - Subtle animations for hover and focus states are added. - Smooth transitions for navigation and modal views are implemented. 13. **Accessibility**: - All interactive elements are accessible. - ARIA labels and roles are used where necessary. - Keyboard navigation support is implemented. 14. **SEO Considerations**: - Meta tags for SEO are added. - The website is crawlable by search engines. 15. **Testing and Optimization**: - Thorough testing for functionality and usability is performed. - Images and assets are optimized for performance. - React.memo() is used for performance optimization where appropriate. 16. **Documentation**: - The codebase is documented with comments and type definitions. - Usage instructions for future maintenance are provided. want to create a user-friendly, two-step form for adding connections to a platform. Here's a clear description of what you want to achieve:  Step 1: Select Client The user selects a client from a dropdown list.  Since each client has only one platform, the platform is automatically associated with the selected client.  The user confirms the selection and proceeds to Step 2.  Step 2: Add Connection Data Based on the platform's type_hebergement (CLOUD, ONPREMISE, or HYBRID), the form dynamically renders the appropriate fields for the connection parameters.  If type_hebergement is CLOUD, the form shows fields for cloud_parameters.  If type_hebergement is ONPREMISE, the user selects a premise_case (SSH, VPN, or IPSEC), and the form shows the corresponding parameters:  SSH: Fields for host, port, username, password, private_key, passphrase, etc.  VPN: Fields for server_address, username, password, protocol, port, certificate, encryption, etc.  IPSEC: Fields for username, password, encryption_method, authentication_method, pre_shared_key, remote_gateway, etc.  If type_hebergement is HYBRID, the form allows the user to add connections for both CLOUD and ONPREMISE cases.  Fixed values like SSH_CLIENT (always "OpenSSH") and VPN_TYPE (always "OpenVPN") are hardcoded and not shown to the user.  Key Relationships Client:  A client has only one platform.  Example: Client 1 has Platform A.  Platform:  A platform belongs to one client.  A platform can have multiple connections.  Example: Platform A has Connection 1 and Connection 2.  Connection:  A connection belongs to one platform.  A connection has a 1:1 relationship with its parameters (ssh_parameters, vpn_parameters, ipsec_parameters, or cloud_parameters), depending on the type_hebergement and premise_case.  Simplified User Experience The user only sees relevant fields, reducing complexity and errors.  The form is intuitive and guides the user through the process step by step.  Fixed values like SSH_CLIENT and VPN_TYPE are handled automatically, so the user doesn't need to worry about them.  Example Workflow Step 1: Select Client  User selects Client 1.  The platform associated with Client 1 (e.g., Platform A) is automatically selected.  User confirms and proceeds to Step 2.  Step 2: Add Connection Data  The form detects that Platform A has type_hebergement = ONPREMISE.  The user selects premise_case = SSH.  The form shows fields for ssh_parameters (e.g., host, port, username, password, etc.).  The user fills in the fields and submits the form.  The connection is created with the provided data.  What You Want to Achieve You want to create a simple and efficient process for users to:  Select a client and its associated platform.  Add connection data based on the platform's type_hebergement and premise_case.  Ensure the form is dynamic and user-friendly, with dropdowns for enums and hidden fields for fixed values.

- Ensure the React app is a single page application with a cohesive design language throughout.
- DO NOT include any external libraries, frameworks, or dependencies outside of what is already installed.
- For icons, create simple, elegant SVG icons. DO NOT use any icon libraries.
- Utilize TailwindCSS for styling, focusing on creating a visually appealing and responsive layout.
- Avoid using arbitrary values (e.g., `h-[600px]`). Stick to Tailwind's predefined classes for consistency.
- Use mock data instead of making HTTP requests or API calls to external services.
- Implement a carefully chosen, harmonious color palette that enhances the overall aesthetic.
- Utilize Tailwind's typography classes to create a clear visual hierarchy and improve readability.
- Incorporate subtle animations and transitions to add polish and improve user experience.
- Ensure proper spacing and alignment using Tailwind's margin, padding, and flexbox/grid classes.
- Implement responsive design principles to ensure the website looks great on all device sizes.
- Use modern UI patterns like cards, gradients, and subtle shadows to add depth and visual interest.
- Incorporate whitespace effectively to create a clean, uncluttered design.
- Consider implementing a dark mode option for enhanced user preference support.
- For images, use a placeholder image from https://placehold.co/

Technical Implementation:
- Use TypeScript for type safety and better code organization
- Implement proper state management using React hooks (useState, useEffect, useContext, etc.)
- Create reusable custom hooks for common functionality
- Use proper TypeScript interfaces and types for all props and state
- Implement error boundaries for graceful error handling
- Use React.memo() for performance optimization where appropriate
- Implement proper form validation and error handling
- Use proper accessibility attributes (ARIA labels, roles, etc.)
- Implement keyboard navigation support
- Ensure semantic HTML structure
- Use React.lazy() and Suspense for code splitting if needed
- Implement proper loading states and skeleton screens
- Use proper error messages and user feedback
- Implement proper form submission handling
- Use proper data validation and sanitization
- Implement proper routing if needed using URL hash navigation
- Use localStorage/sessionStorage for client-side data persistence
- Implement proper event handling and cleanup

UI/UX Design Focus:
- Typography: Use a combination of font weights and sizes to create visual interest and hierarchy
- Color: Implement a cohesive color scheme that complements the content and enhances usability
- Layout: Design an intuitive and balanced layout that guides the user's eye and facilitates easy navigation
- Microinteractions: Add subtle hover effects, transitions, and animations to enhance user engagement
- Consistency: Maintain a consistent design language throughout all components and sections
- Mobile-first approach: Design for mobile devices first, then enhance for larger screens
- Touch targets: Ensure all interactive elements are large enough for touch input
- Loading states: Implement skeleton screens and loading indicators
- Error states: Design clear error messages and recovery paths
- Empty states: Design meaningful empty states with clear calls to action
- Success states: Provide clear feedback for successful actions
- Interactive elements: Design clear hover and active states
- Form design: Create intuitive and user-friendly forms with proper validation feedback
- Navigation: Implement clear and consistent navigation patterns
- Search functionality: Implement proper search UI if needed
- Filtering and sorting: Design clear UI for data manipulation if needed
- Pagination: Implement proper pagination UI if needed
- Modal and dialog design: Create proper modal and dialog UI if needed
- Toast notifications: Implement proper notification system if needed
- Progress indicators: Show clear progress for multi-step processes
- Data visualization: Implement clear and intuitive data visualizations if needed

Pay special attention to the following. Make sure the app is usable and functional and works as expected.

Remember to only return code for the App.tsx file and nothing else. Prioritize creating an exceptional layout, styling, and reactivity. The resulting application should be visually impressive, highly functional, and something users would be proud to showcase.
